results.title: The Tolkien Trilogy  for Commodore 64
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Two cassettes, paper manual, plastic cassette tray in a cardboard case
results.brief_description: Contains three games: ‘The Hobbit’, ‘Lord of the Rings’ and ‘Shadows of Mordor’. The games are loosely based on “The Hobbit” and “The Lord of the Rings” novels by J.R.R Tolkien

results.title: Bedlam for ZX Spectrum 128/+2
results.creator_credit: GO! Media Holdings Ltd and Beam Software
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover in clear plastic cassette case
results.brief_description: Bedlam [computer game]. Bedlam is a top down vertical shooting scroller in a futuristic sci fi setting for one or two players simultaneously. Players pilot a vehicle shooting and dodging aliens and fighting boss ships.

results.title: Demon Stalkers for Commodore 64/128
results.creator_credit: Electronic Arts and Micro Forte Studios
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover, code wheel, warranty card & manual (paper booklet) in clear plastic cassette case
results.brief_description:
Demon Stalkers is an action RPG and editor/construction set game. It is similar to Atari’s Gauntlet. The player can choose either the hero, armed with throwing knives, or the heroine, armed with a crossbow who must travel through ninety-nine mazes before meeting the final demon. The game features different enemies as you progress through the mazes, with clues to progression built in. There is also a two-player co-operative mode. The in-built level editor uses pull-down menus and offers a high level of flexibility. As well as creating actual levels, the player can create an integrated storyline and game world, since the in-game text can also be edited.
The game shipped with a Magic Cipher consisting of three cardboard wheels that, when moved to the correct positions, revealed the passwords were needed to access some of the lower levels of the dungeon. Some of the vital text in the cipher is in a tone of blue that could not be photocopied at that point, making the cipher a basic anti-piracy measure.

Source: Play It Again website:
http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/demon-stalkers/

Last accessed: 14/04/2021

Original game developed by Micro Forte Studios for Commodore 64 and 128, published in 1987 by Electronic Arts.

The game features different enemies as you progress through the mazes, with clues to progression built in. There is also a two-player co-operative mode. results.title: Out of Sight, Out of Mind
results.creator_credit: David Goldie and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: ‘Out of Sight, Out of Mind’, in its depiction of prison conditions, helped to raise awareness about a much neglected section of our society. It provided extensive insight into the prison system, interviewing prisoners, prison officers and administrators. There are four parts titled ‘Locked Up’, ‘Surviving in the Nick’, ‘The Keepers and the Kept’, and ‘The Cycle of Crime’. This program pulls no punches, describes the conditions of various correctional institutions around Australia and also offers some suggestions for improvements.

results.title: Access Video 1973-1982
results.creator_credit: Open Channel Productions and Helen Eisler
results.brief_description:
The results of a reserach project funded by the Australian Film Commission and the Commonwealth Employment Programme this title presents highlights of programmes of historical importance, demonstrating the growth and maturing of independent video which in turn reflects the development of community and political activity during the seventies.

During this decade 12 access video centres were established. This title shows highlights of proigrammes made by various centres.

results.title: A Dairyland Romance
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture, Keith Harrison and Jack Keane
results.brief_description:
Story revolves around the importance of choosing breeding partners that have good breeding themselves and the benefits that this will bring their offspring. It stars two cows with human characteristics (standing on two legs, wearing clothes, speaking english, etc.) being interviewed about their successful partnership together and goes on to give information on correct rearing techniques. Hand-painted animation looks suberb and the deadpan delivery of the main charcaters is very amusing.

Illustrated ‘The End’ and opening titles.

results.title: Werribee: in harmony with nature
results.creator_credit: Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works and Filmpartnership
results.brief_description: Deals with the disposal of Melbourne’s sewage through the land sewerage scheme at Werribee farm which involves natural purification and recycling.

results.title: Here's your bike, Ed!
results.creator_credit: Steve Westh, John Taylor, Taylormade Films and Vic Roads
results.brief_description: The purpose of this title is to demonstrate a variety of skills that children need to cycle safely on roads. Designed to accompany a Bike Ed program in schools, with Teacher’s notes, there are a variety of activities and drills which will develop children’s confidence as bike riders and users of the road.
